definition: to move (i.e. relocate oneself)/to move (sth relatively heavy or bulky)/to shift/to copy indiscriminately

sentences.english: The porter， however， could not understand me.
sentences.chinese: 然而搬運工卻不明白我的話。

sentences.english: Yes. Just tell the redcap you want a taxi.
sentences.chinese: 是的，只要告訴搬運工你要叫輛出租車。

sentences.english: Additional expenses come when enlisting the help of porters and guides.
sentences.chinese: 如果你僱傭搬運工和嚮導的話，還回增加額外的開支。

sentences.english: The porters may be identified by their red caps.
sentences.chinese: 從他們戴的紅帽子就可以辨認出他們是行李搬運工。

sentences.english: A porter from the Galaxy Hotel is welcoming Mr.
sentences.chinese: 一位銀河賓館的行李搬運工在大廳裏接待布朗先生。

sentences.english: B:Yes.Just tell the redcap you want a taxi.
sentences.chinese: 是的，只要告訴搬運工你要叫輛出租車。

sentences.english: The porter and I looked at each other and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 我不認去留館的路，就像一個搬運工打聽。

sentences.english: For porters working at transfer posts, Spring Festival is the busiest time.
sentences.chinese: 在轉運站裏面工作的搬運工們過年的時候是最累的。

sentences.english: To her horror he said that she was two hours too soon.
sentences.chinese: 搬運工說她早到了兩個小時，她聽後大喫一驚。
搬運工，我的小客室號碼是8號。

sentences.english: The thirsty porter uncovered the kettle , and then drank the juice until the last drop.
sentences.chinese: 那位口渴的搬運工揭開壺蓋，把一壺果汁喝光了。

sentences.english: "These" porters games travel trailers and fifth wheel combination.
sentences.chinese: 這些玩具搬運工旅行拖車和第五輪相結合。

sentences.english: Transit workers and supermarket employees began wearing masks.
sentences.chinese: 搬運工和超級市場員工開始戴口罩。

sentences.english: The more abusive the businessman became, the calmer the porter seemed.
sentences.chinese: 商人越是無理，搬運工卻顯得越加心平氣和。

sentences.english: He's the porter who/that carried my suitcase.
sentences.chinese: 他就是那個扛着我的衣箱的搬運工。

definition: erhua variant of 哥們|哥们[ge1 men5]
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
impossible/can't be done/no can do/unable to accomplish
to find joy in sorrows (idiom); to enjoy sth in spite of one's suffering
to digress/to stray from the subject
arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
